content:
BrowserCapabilitiesCodeGenerator Class

Definition

The BrowserCapabilitiesCodeGenerator class is used internally by the aspnet_regbrowsers tool to parse .browser browser definition files and add browsers to the run-time collection of known browsers contained in the BrowserCapabilitiesFactory object.

In this Article

public class BrowserCapabilitiesCodeGenerator
Inheritance
System.Object
BrowserCapabilitiesCodeGenerator

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

This class generates the source code for an assembly for the BrowserCapabilitiesFactory class, which, at run time, produces request-specific HttpCapabilitiesBase objects to be publicly accessed through the ASP.NET intrinsic Request.Browser property.

Constructors

BrowserCapabilitiesCodeGenerator()

Used internally to create a new instance of BrowserCapabilitiesCodeGenerator.

public BrowserCapabilitiesCodeGenerator ();

Methods

Create()

Used internally to coordinate the behavior of this class.

public virtual void Create ();

Remarks

This method first iterates through the "Browsers" folder. It then calls ProcessBrowserFiles, which loads and parses the XML contained in a collection of browser-definition files and inserts the information contained therein into an internal collection of browsers. Then it calls an internal method which generates the source code compiles it, and registers it as an assembly in the global assembly cache for the BrowserCapabilitiesFactory object. If necessary, this method then calls an internal method that restarts the Web server.

ProcessBrowserFiles(Boolean,String)

Loads and parses the XML contained in a collection of browser-definition files and inserts the information contained therein into an internal collection of browsers.

protected void ProcessBrowserFiles (bool useVirtualPath, string virtualDir);
useVirtualPath
Boolean

true to use a virtual path; otherwise, false. The default is false.

virtualDir
String

The path to the virtual directory that contains the browser-definition files. The default is String.

Exceptions
HttpParseException

One of the browser-definition files does not have a root element named "browsers".

- or -

One of the browser-definition files fails to load.

Uninstall()

Removes the browser capabilities factory from the global assembly cache and deletes its strong name public key token file.

public bool Uninstall ();
Returns
Boolean

true if the browser capabilities factory was uninstalled from the global assembly cache; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This method restarts the Web service. The browser capabilities factory is then removed from the global assembly cache, and its strong name public key token file is deleted. The Web service is then restarted again if the uninstall succeeds.
